online.game
Interface RobotProtocol

All Superinterfaces:
SimpleRobotProtocol
All Known Implementing Classes:
CheckerPlay, commonRobot, HexPlay
public interface RobotProtocol
extends SimpleRobotProtocol

SimpleRobotProtocol plus some extra methods to interface with the search driver is all your robot has to implement to do a complete search.

Author:
ddyer
See Also:
SimpleRobotProtocol

getViewer

ViewerProtocol getViewer()
get the game viewer (the UI) for this game

Returns:
a ViewerProtol (ie, a viewer)

getInitialWinRate

double getInitialWinRate(commonMove move,
                         commonMove[] children)
For UCT searches, return the initial bias for "wins" of a particular move. Nominally this should be in the range of -1 to 1. The exact values only matter relative to the other children of the same parent. This number is combined with the search driver UCTMoveSearcher.initialWinRateWeight. This combination effectively provides the results for a fixed number of fake visits that bias the initial probabilities that this child will be investigated further.

Parameters:
move - the move under consideration
children - the full list of moves at this level
Returns:
a double in -1 to 1

Search_Break

void Search_Break(java.lang.String msg)
various search events call this method. Your robot can override this method and you can breakpoint it to intercept these events and look around.

See Also:
stop_at_eval_clock, stop_at_search_clock

Game_Over_P

boolean Game_Over_P()
retutn true if the game is over at the current position. for use by the alpha-beta search driver

Get_Random_Move

commonMove Get_Random_Move(Random rand)
get a random move using seed rand. The default implementation of this calls List_Of_Legal_Moves

rand -
Returns:
one of the moves or null as an error indication

Static_Evaluate_Position

double Static_Evaluate_Position(commonMove m)
static evaluate the current board position from the viewpoint of "forplayer" At this point the move has already been made. The move spec is supplied so it can be used to store values of interest.

Parameters:
m - the move to evaluate.

Width_Limit_Moves

int Width_Limit_Moves(int depth,
                      int maxdepth,
                      commonMove[] mvec,
                      int sz)
width limit (or otherwise modify) the array of moves. The moves have been evaluated and sorted, so the high scorers and terminal are first, so the appropriate thing is to remove from the end. the return value is the new value of sz, the first sz moves are used.

Parameters:
depth - current depth of search
maxdepth - current max depth
mvec - a sorted array of moves
sz - the current number of those
Returns:
the number of moves remaining

reScorePosition

double reScorePosition(commonMove cm,
                       int forplayer)
re-score the value of the move as it is being passed to the caller. For 2 player games, the default implementation will handle this correctly by negating the value if the player changes. For multiplayer games, the static evaluation should store separate values for each player to allow recalculating the value for the desired player.

targetMoveForEvaluation

commonMove targetMoveForEvaluation(commonMove cm)
return the move that should be re-evaluated for search purposes. For 2 player games this is the same move. For multiplayer games it's the ultimate leaf node.

Parameters:
cm -
Returns:
a move spec

Unmake_Move

void Unmake_Move(commonMove m)
undo the effect of making move m. The result should completely revert the board back to the original state.

Parameters:
m -

Backprop_Random_Move

                          double val)
call when about to backpropogate unmove of m in the random tree

Parameters:
m -

                    int max)

Tree_Depth_Limit

boolean Tree_Depth_Limit(int current)
for UCT searchers, return true if the tree part should be limited here. default is false;

Parameters:
current -
Returns:

NormalizedScore

double NormalizedScore(commonMove lastMove)
normalized value to -1 to 1, normally used to score endgames for UCT

                         double val,

lastMove -
val -
forPlayer -

the normalized value (in -1.0 to 1.0) for a particular player

WinForPlayer

boolean WinForPlayer(commonMove lastMove)
This is used to optimize nodes where a winning move exists.

Parameters:
lastMove -
Returns:
true if the current position is a win for the player of commonMove.

Evaluate_And_Sort_Moves

int Evaluate_And_Sort_Moves(Search_Driver dr,
                            Search_Node sn,
                            commonMove[] mvec)
normally, call dr.Evaluate_And_Sort_Moves(sn,mvec) but possibly do something else, or nothing.

Parameters:
dr -
sn -
mvec -
Returns:
the number of moves remaining in mvec

getGame

getTreeViewer

UCTTreeViewer getTreeViewer()

getBestWinrateMove

commonMove getBestWinrateMove(UCTNode parent,
                              Random r,
                              UCTMoveSearcher randomization)
get the move with the best win rate. If r and randomization are significant, add a random factor to each winrate. This is used to randomize the behavior of the first few moves in a game. if randomization>1, select among the top n moves if randomization>0, add a random bias between 0 and randomization to the visitation percent

Parameters:
parent - the root uctnode
r - the randomization seed to use
randomization - the search driver
Returns:
the selected move
